metadata.Title: CVE-2023-42464 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A Type Confusion vulnerability was found in the Spotlight RPC functions inafpd in Netatalk 3.1.x before 3.1.17. When parsing Spotlight RPC packets,one encoded data structure is a key-value style dictionary where the keysare character strings, and the values can be any of the supported types inthe underlying protocol. Due to a lack of type checking in callers of thedalloc_value_for_key() function, which returns the object associated with akey, a malicious actor may be able to fully control the value of thepointer and theoretically achieve Remote Code Execution on the host. Thisissue is similar to CVE-2023-34967.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

netatalk - 3.1.12~ds-4ubuntu0.20.04.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: netatalk package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.12~ds-4ubuntu0.20.04.3').
